body_html:
@Lewington-pitsos Illegal instruction (core dumped) points to the fact that an instruction that isn't supported by the processor was executed. I happen to know that in the RNG code, we do use SSE4.1/SSE4.2/SSE4.3 instructions. There isn't a list, but you can check what features your processor supports by issuing particular commands:

  • Windows: Download and run coreinfo -f
  • OSX: Run sysctl -a | grep machdep.cpu.features
  • Linux: Check /proc/cpuinfo

Reference: https://arnoldsupport.com/2016/10/08/arnold-mtoa-how-to-check-if-your-processor-supports-sse4-1/

body:
@Lewington-pitsos `Illegal instruction (core dumped)` points to the fact that an instruction that isn't supported by the processor was executed. I happen to know that in the RNG code, we do use `SSE4.1/SSE4.2/SSE4.3` instructions. There isn't a list, but you can check what features your processor supports by issuing particular commands:

- Windows: Download and run coreinfo -f
- OSX: Run sysctl -a | grep machdep.cpu.features
- Linux: Check /proc/cpuinfo

Reference: https://arnoldsupport.com/2016/10/08/arnold-mtoa-how-to-check-if-your-processor-supports-sse4-1/
